Articles.Content:
I need to confirm if this is quite the same bug as the existing "camera bug", but I've been experiencing an odd bug where after booting up KSP and opening up a save, the camera is set to a low angle looking at the SPH (about as high as the Astronaut Complex) from the area of the R&D department. I can't click on any of the buildings. (This is 1.05, and is not build 1024)

I have the following mods: Analog Control, Aviator Arsenal, BD FPS, BDArmory/CAL, BDA Vessel Switcher, Firespitter (including plane parts), Hullcam VDS, KAX, KerbalFoundries (with dust effects removed), KerbalKrashSystem (an early version, the new version seems to cause excessive lag), KIS, Infernal Robotics, Fengist's Maritime Pack, Mechjeb 2, NANA Wildfire, Naval Artillery System, No Offset Limits, Old School Turrets (the version updated for BDA v10), SCPanzerMod (with a good deal of parts removed), Take Command, and BDA Vessel Mover

The odd thing is that it does this most, but not all of the time (and it became more frequent after installing MechJeb)

Output_log.txt: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/qwlbddqpgq3btpv/AAAwLwtA6_pei2Q8I4lJUsjga?dl=0

Will post screenshots if necessary
It happens to me if I don't allow the game window to stay in focus for the entire time. If I quit to main menu, tab away, tab back, and reload the save it is fixed (for me).
Clearing the input lock stack in the alt+F12 debug window should return camera control.
Or use my modlet below (oh I need to upload it again tonight) that automatically clears the offending input lock in the stack.
What I do is I go out back to the start screen and re-load the saved game.
